gene.function: FUNCTION: Appears to function predominantly as a heterodimeric complex with ILF3. This complex may regulate transcription of the IL2 gene during T-cell activation. It can also promote the formation of stable DNA-dependent protein kinase holoenzyme complexes on DNA. Essential for the efficient reshuttling of ILF3 (isoform 1 and isoform 2) into the nucleus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10574923, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11739746, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21123651, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9442054}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleolus. Cytoplasm. Nucleus. Note=Localized in cytoplasmic mRNP granules containing untranslated mRNAs.
